response: "{ \"title\": \"Maximum Sum of a Subsequence\", \"description\": \"Given an array `arr` of positive integers, find the maximum sum that can be obtained by selecting a subsequence from it. A subsequence is a sequence that can be derived from another sequence by deleting some or no elements without changing the order.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef max_subsequence_sum(arr: list[int)) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of positive integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the maximum sum that can be obtained by selecting a subsequence from the input array.\\n\", \"code\": \"\\nimport heapq\\n\\ndef max_subsequence_sum(arr: list[int]) -> int:\\n    heap = []\\n    for num in arr:\\n        if not heap or num > -heap[0]:\\n            heapq.heappush(heap, num)\\n        else:\\n            heapq.heappop(heap)\\n            heapq.heappush(heap, -num)\\n\\n    return sum(heap) * 2\\n\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert max_subsequence_sum([1, 3, 5, 2]) == 9\", \"assert max_subsequence_sum([-1, -5, 0, 4]) == 7\", \"assert max_subsequence_sum([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) == 15\"] }"
